titleStmt.title: Proposals for national banks whereby the profirs on usury, to reduc'd to three per cent. per annum, will supply his Majesty more plentifully than ever to carry on the war, exempt the nation from land taxes, great customs and excises, exceedingly promote trade and navigation, and give England many other very large advantages.

editionStmt.edition: The second impression with corrections and additions.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for the author, and sold by Peter Parker at the Leg and Star over against the Royal Exchange in Corn-hill, and John Waltho at the Cloysters in the Temple, and John Gouge at the Castle in Westminster-Hall,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
